project.teaser: The WHO Classification of Tumours (WCT) underpins cancer diagnosis, and hence treatment and care of cancer patients, as well as research into cancer epidemiology, prevention, diagnosis, and treatment. However, decisions for such a global reference tool are not always informed...
project.objective: The WHO Classification of Tumours (WCT) underpins cancer diagnosis, and hence treatment and care of cancer patients, as well as research into cancer epidemiology, prevention, diagnosis, and treatment. However, decisions for such a global reference tool are not always informed by the best available evidence, and risks of incorporating misinformation into the clinical decisions pathway exist. We aim to develop a tool that maps existing evidence, showing gaps, identifying pockets of low-level evidence, and synthesis of reliable evidence. The tool will map the evidence base of the WCT in order to facilitate evidence-based decision-making in pathology, and promote the application of higher research standards in the field. We will adapt the recently developed Evidence Gap Map (EGM) methodology, first time ever to be used in biomedicine. The resulting EGMs will increase the discoverability and use of studies by the WCT decision-makers, research commissioners, researchers and others. Our WCT-EVI-MAP project is organized in three subsequent phases, where we will apply a stepwise approach to: first, develop a framework and define evidence levels based on expert consensus; second, elaborate a series of Megamaps in iterative cycles describing evidence of all tumour types; third, perform a descriptive analysis of the use of evidence in a continuous updated exercise. To overcome identified challenges, several strategies are proposed, such as using recent advances in technologies, following a strict multidisciplinary approach and integrating this project into the WCT strategic planning for the 6th edition. We believe that the WCT EVI-MAP will represent a ground-breaking advance for the WCT and research in the field, and will accelerate progress in cancer diagnosis and management. Integration of evidence-based medicine methods has been shown to have a positive impact in other specialized medical fields and our project represents a first step towards an evidence-based pathology.
project.title: Mapping the Evidence for the WHO Classification of Tumours: a Living Evidence Gap Map by Tumour Type.
project.keywords: WHO Classification of tumours, Evidence Gap Maps, Evidence-based decisions-making

article.title: Innovative tool for evidence-based tumour classification

result.title: Workshop on training in EGM methods for potential focal points
result.description: Workshop to maximize the impact of WCT EVI MAP will be planned and will focus on EGM methodology and framework development for the WCT, and will include all WCT EVI MAP partners. the meeting will be open to potential end-users of the WCT EVI MAP tool, including outside investigators, stakeholders and patient representatives.The training will be practice oriented, using common workshop methodology and include at least content on these knowledge areas: EGM methodology; Essentials on epidemiology and logic that underpins evidence level hierarchy; Essentials on cancer classification and research in pathology; Training in the use of software to be used for the mapping of the evidence Online or presential modality will be proposed, depending on travel.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - WCT EVI MAP (Mapping the Evidence for the WHO Classification of Tumours: a Living Evidence Gap Map by Tumour Type.)
result.teaser: Cancer classification is essential for cancer diagnosis and treatment. The WHO Classification of Tumours underpins cancer diagnosis worldwide and sets global standards in cancer classification. Therefore, the use of the WCT as a global reference tool means that it is vital the...

Promotion of the project and disseminate outcomes and activities (including organization of meetings to showcase the results of WCT EVI MAP project and tool launch).

result.description: A collaborative effort will take place to develop a cost-efficient mapping software adapted to the project needs. Outcomes of this collaborative work will be published and shared with the community of software developers.

details.journalTitle: Journal of Evaluation in Clinical Practice

result.title: Launch of the WCT EVI MAP tool
result.description: Open access online available tool starting to implement and integrate the required features with conditions that include quality of included studies, (bibliometric) data sources and language

result.title: Scientific publication endorsed by IC3R of a statement including standards for reporting (reporting guidelines)
result.description: Once the panel reaches consensus on the criteria, the steering committee drafts and publishes the new levels hierarchy as well as reporting recommendations. A check list to aid following recommendations for publications will be included I the final and the Equator Network will be contacted to help disseminate the statement and make it available at their website.

details.authors: Wong, CJW; Md Nasir, ND; Koh, VCY; Campbell, F; Fox, S; Lakhani, SR; Myles, N; Yip, G; Colling, R; Cree, IA; Lokuhetty, D; Tan, PH

result.title: Annual report on project progression Y1
result.description: A short progress report each year will be submitted to the EC. In addition, the coordinating office will remain in close communication with the EC project officer regarding the progress of the project.

result.title: Scientific publication of adapted evidence levels for the field of pathology
result.description: The steering committee drafts and publishes the new levels hierarchy as well as reporting recommendations and the Equator Network will be contacted to help disseminate the statement and make it available at their website.

result.title: Annual report on project progression Y2
result.description: A short progress report each year will be submitted to the EC. In addition, the coordinating office will remain in close communication with the EC project officer regarding the progress of the project.

result.title: Scientific publications on specific Megamaps and findings
result.description: M12 to M36For each Work Package with scientific activities a writing group will be established at the first meeting of the Consortium and authorship rules will be developed. The decision concerning the publication of Megamaps will be made by the decision-making bodies of the consortium. Peer reviewed scientific publications will be made accessible via Open access.

result.title: Project launch and kick-off meeting.
result.description: Careful planning, including identification of key milestones, potential bottlenecks and timely action to avert them, is of utmost importance for this project. Contingency plans will be prepared to cover specific and particularly critical aspects of the project

result.title: Inauguration Network of WCT EVI MAP tool focal points
result.description: Interested collaborators and current partners will be approached establish a network of focal points responsible for the regular update of Megamaps. A training program based on practical online workshops will be developed during the first year, and focal points tasks and responsibilities defined.

result.title: Annual report on project progression Y3
result.description: A short progress report each year will be submitted to the EC. In addition, the coordinating office will remain in close communication with the EC project officer regarding the progress of the project.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
